Authors:
Qian Sun, Dulanjalee L Harishchandra, Wei ZHANG, Jing yi
Jia, Qiang Zuo, Guo zhen Zhang, JiYe Yan, Qi Wang, Xing hong Li
Title:
Neopestalotiopsis rosae causing root rot on strawberry in
China
Keywords:
Fragaria×ananassa, China, Neopestalotiopsis rosae, root
rot
Abstract:
Strawberry root rot a major disease affecting the
production of strawberry (Fragaria×ananassa Duchesne), has caused damage
and great losses. In the current study, strawberry plants displaying
root rot symptoms were collected in Beijing, China, during 2018 and
2019. Eight representative isolates were isolated from the symptomatic
roots. Based on morphology and phylogenetic analysis of combined the
internal transcribed spacer (ITS) region, β-tubulin and transcription
elongation factor 1-α (tef1) region all of our isolates were identified
as Neopestalotiopsis rosae, and its pathogenicity was confirmed. This is
the first report of N. rosae causing root rot disease on
strawberry.
